overview: This subject examines the workplace environment and the range of competencies needed to operate effectively. Communication is central to success in the workplace, from proposing projects, consulting and influencing colleagues, through to reporting. Students will gain a range of communication skills in writing, oral and presentation skills, and using graphics and statistics, to communicate science to others with whom they work.

assessments.description: Written Examination. 2 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Students must pass the final examination to pass the subject.

Semester 2.Contact hours: 36 hours comprising one 3-hour seminar per week.

Prescribed texts: The Business Communication Handbook with Student Resource Access 12 Months 10th Edition
